title: Misericordia connected script
content:
this font is from the clothing company, Misericordia, and i at firsthought it was a cutstom font from the title, but it appears not by the body copy being more unified..

If anybody could shed some light on the name of this font would be greatly appreciated :)

cheers.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [equiponb.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185011/http:/typophile.com/files/equiponb.gif) | 24.76 KB |

 [‹ (x) UBSA techno sans logo - Newtron ICG Open {Antonio Cavedoni}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185011/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36772 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) MyFlorist serif logo - Brighton {Akira} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185011/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36798 "Go to next forum topic")
author: beek

comments.content: I’m guessing the logo is hand lettered, and then a typeface was made to emulate it.
[Mousse](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185011/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000162) has some similarities, though it’s less Latino.
If it isn’t hand-lettered, it has a ton of alternates.
this actually reminds me quite a bit of [Metroscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185011/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=ALSO-MESR) for some reason.

Im positive this isnt hand rendered, i have seen it used somewhere else as well.. (will try locate)

Im not worried about the latine asoect, i just love the way it is excecuted.
a few minutes with difference layers in Photoshop reveals that if this isn’t hand-lettered, it’s been modified so much that no two characters are the same.

if this isn’t hand-lettered, it’s been modified so much that no two characters are the same.
 That’s what I thought. I must admit it does look familiar though. If we find out who did it, I will probably have to slap my forehead.

Reminds me of Bello Script from Underware

[http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=bello&id2=script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185011/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=bello&id2=script "http://www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=bello&id2=script")

Should be a font, look at M and L and y.  
They are just too close to be handwritten.

It reminds me of [Spoleto](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202185011/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptSmall6/Spoleto.gif), which is a.k.a. Sport Script, etc. that has been modified (s and l were first obvious new letters) and backslanted. I can see there are variations in identical letters, so is this hand-drawn or an OpenType font with lots of alternates? Also made me think of some of the faux-Coke lettering fonts.

- Mike Yanega
[mysterious double-post — I only clicked once, really!]
